River Queen attempts to pack a complicated, sweeping, historical narrative into just under two hours. There are some breathtaking battle scenes and the Wanganui scenery is beautiful, but the crowning descision made by director Vincent Ward is the complete lack of subtitles for any of this movie's non-English dialogue. As a result, River Queen plays like an acid trip where you don't laugh at or freak out over what others are seeing; instead you watch "the best bits"

The wealthy fliers have long since left Planet Earth, for adventures in the countless empires that make up the Galaxy beyond. Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is clearly an attempt to catch the wave of martial arts popularity ; It borrows many characteristics and themes from Asian and American cinema alike, while also offering a story with few twists or surprises.
